anomalies.message: [REJECT] Written amount contains a spelling error (“FIVETY” instead of “FIFTY”), indicating document tampering.
Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern
Amount alteration: spelling error in written amount

raw_text:
WESTERN WESTERN UNION®
UNION
MONEY ORDER
PAY TO: Hareen Edla
737267558
AMOUNT:
$325.00
DATE: NOVEMBER 27TH, 2025
THREE HUNDRED FIVETY AND 00// 00 DOLLARS
FROM: JOHN DOE
123 OAK ST, ANYTOWN, CA 91234
4783667589
AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE

feature_importance: Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern
fraud_indicators: Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern

ai_analysis.summary: Written amount contains a spelling error (“FIVETY” instead of “FIFTY”), indicating document tampering.
reasoning: Raw OCR text of the amount reads “THREE HUNDRED FIVETY AND 00// 00 DOLLARS” with “FIVETY” misspelled.
Per policy, any spelling error in the written amount is a strong indicator of AMOUNT_ALTERATION fraud.
Training data shows 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches or tampering.
Although the ML score is low (0.0%), manual inspection of raw text overrides and identifies clear alteration.
key_indicators: Amount alteration: spelling error in written amount
actionable_recommendations: Verify the correct printed wording format against an authentic Western Union money order sample.
Contact Western Union to confirm validity of serial number 737267558.
Request purchaser identity verification and a reissued money order with correct print.

reasons: Raw OCR shows “FIVETY” instead of “FIFTY,” a clear spelling error in the written amount line.
Such errors strongly correlate with tampering, per internal training patterns.

ai_analysis.training_insights: In our 2,000-case dataset, 45% of confirmed frauds featured altered or mismatched amounts.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: No directly similar past cases, but consistent with high-risk amount alteration patterns.
